chapter.pericope: People Generally Do Not Know What is Best for Them

ul.li1: 1A good name is better than precious ointment,
ul.li2: and the day of death is better than the day of one’s birth.
ul.li1: 2Better to go to the house of mourning
ul.li2: than to go to the house of feasting,
ul.li1: for death is the end of every person,
ul.li2: and the living should take it to his heart.
ul.li1: 3Sorrow is better than laughter,
ul.li2: for by sadness of countenance the heart is made good.
ul.li1: 4The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning,
ul.li2: but the heart of fools is in the house of mirth.
ul.li1: 5Better to listen to the rebuke of the wise
ul.li2: than for a man to listen to the song of fools.
ul.li1: 6Like the sound of thorns under a pot,
ul.li2: so also the laughter of fools.
ul.li1: This also is vanity!
7Surely oppression makes a fool of the wise,
ul.li2: and a bribe corrupts the heart.
ul.li1: 8The end of a matter is better than its beginning;
ul.li2: better to be slow to anger than hot-headed.Literally “one who is long of spirit is better than one who is high of spirit”
ul.li1: 9Do not be quick in your spirit to anger,
ul.li2: for anger lodges in the bosom of fools.
ul.li1: 10Do not say, “Why were the former days better than these?”
ul.li2: For it is not from wisdom that you ask this.
ul.li1: 11Wisdom is good with an inheritance;
ul.li2: it benefits the living.Literally “to those who see the sun”
ul.li1: 12For wisdom offers protection like money offers protection.Literally “For in the shade of wisdom is the shade of money”
ul.li2: But knowledge has an advantage—wisdom restores life to its possessor.

chapter.pericope: Humans Must Accept God’s Will and Make the Best of It

ul.li1: 13Consider the work of God.
ul.li2: For who is able to make straight what he made crooked?
ul.li1: 14In the day of prosperity, rejoice!
ul.li2: But in the day of adversity, consider!
ul.li1: For God made one in place of another
ul.li2: so that mortals cannot find out what will happen in the future.Literally “after him”

chapter.pericope: The Law of Retribution Does Not Always Work—but It Does Sometimes

ul.li1: 15I have seen all these things in my vain life:
ul.li2: Sometimes a righteous man perishes in spite of his righteousness,
ul.li3: and sometimes a wicked man lives a long life in spite of his evil.
ul.li1: 16Do not be excessivelyOr “abundantly” righteous,
ul.li2: and do not act excessively wise, lest you destroy yourself.
ul.li1: 17Do not act excessively wicked,
ul.li2: and do not be a fool, lest you die before your time.
ul.li1: 18It is good to take hold of the one and also must not let go of the other;
ul.li2: for whoever fears God will hold both of them secure.

chapter.pericope: Wisdom is Valuable, but No One is Completely Righteous

ul.li1: 19Wisdom gives more strength to the wise
ul.li2: than ten rulers who are in the city.
ul.li1: 20Surely there is no one righteous on the earth
ul.li2: who continually does good and never sins.
ul.li1: 21Do not pay attention to everything people say,
ul.li2: lest you hear your own servant curse you.
ul.li1: 22For your heart knows
ul.li2: that you also have cursed others many times.

chapter.p: 23All this I have tested with wisdom. I said, “I will be wise!” but it was beyond my grasp.Literally “it was far from me” 24Whatever is—it is far beyond comprehension.Literally “That which is—it is far and deep deep” Who can discover it?

25I set my mind to try to seek wisdom and the plan, and to know that wickedness is foolishness and that folly is delusion. 26I myself found that more bitter than death is the woman who is a trap, whose heart is a snare, and whose hands are bonds. The one who pleases God escapes from her, but the sinner is caught by her. 27“Look! I found this,” said the Teacher,Hebrew “Qohelet” “while trying to find how the plan fits together. 28What my heart sought, I did not find. Although I found one righteous man among one thousand, I did not find one upright woman among all these. 29Look! This alone I found: God made mankind upright, but they have devised many schemes.”
